`- _root_.Odd.coprime_two_left`
`- _root_.Odd.coprime_two_right`

`- add_right_cancel`

`----------- _`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash

## more verbose report:

```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Why do we not want to protect it anymore? Should the lemma below be protected? Or should it at least get a comment?
It is protected in Lean now.
Just flagging: we're deciding to not add it back. Which is fine with me.
Just flagging: we're deciding to not add it back. Which is fine with me.
Just flagging: we're deciding to not add it back. Which is fine with me.

```suggestion
@[simp]
protected theorem coe_id : ⇑(Dilation.id α) = id :=
```
This seems like a reasonable one to protect, I think.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: deal with porting notes about 'protected'
